result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela M Cross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with Standard release conditions. 
Sentence credit of 6 days was granted. TIME SERVED.

Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing on 10-01-2022 and each month thereafter. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

2:36 PM Defendant Pamela M Cross in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Pamela M Cross.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All parties are ready for sentencing. 
State gives sentencing recommendations. 
Defense gives sentencing recommendations. 

Court orders the following:
6 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
6 DAYS CREDIT
TIME SERVED

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10/1/22, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
